.
The town was mainly agricultural until the 1900s, when Klien Chocolate Company and several shoe factories opened. Currently the town probably best known for the small college in town, Elizabethtown College. Locals and college alumni often refer to the town as "E-town".

All Amtrak trains going between Harrisburg and Philadelphia stop in Elizabethtown. Also, one can arrive by automobile. Buses run by the Red Rose Transit Authority connect Elizabethtown to Lancaster City, but are infrequent and do not run at night.
There is very little mass transit in the area. It is possible to walk from the train station through downtown Elizabethtown to Elizabethtown College. Driving is a more common way to get around.

value: content= Small comprehensive college founded by the Church of the Brethren in 1899. Lovely campus of read brick buildings, especially nice to walk around on a sunny spring or fall day.
hours= Wednesdays, Thursdays & Fridays, from 9:30AM to 3PM. Additional times by appointment.

content= Community driven effort to preserve and interpret some of Elizabethtown's earliest structures. Museum consists of three original log structures dating from 1750 to 1847 and a brick house from 1877. The museum offers many annual programs.
content= Local dive bar; cheap drinks with pool and darts.
content= Typical chain hotel. Generally the hotel will be booked up the weekend the Elizabethtown College graduates (middle of May).
name= Amanda Gish House Bed & Breakfast
price= About $100 to $150 depending on the room.
content= 19th Century bed and breakfast filled with antiques.

Elizabethtown is located in the heart of Lancaster County. Be sure to get out and explore the Pennsylvania Dutch country side, see an Amish horse and buggy, and check out Lancaster city.
Hershey Park is also only about a 20 minute drive away.
